skill.name: bitbucket-devops
skill.description: Comprehensive Bitbucket pipeline automation using direct Node.js API calls. Monitor pipeline status, analyze failures, download logs, and trigger builds. Use this skill when the user asks to check pipeline status, find failing pipelines, download logs, trigger builds, or debug pipeline failures. No MCP approval prompts required - uses Bash tool with node commands.
skill.summary: Comprehensive Bitbucket pipeline automation using direct Node.js API calls. Monitor pipeline status,...
skill.author: Apra-Labs

security_audit.summary: Most static detections are in documentation, changelogs, or API specs and are not executable. Core code executes CLI commands and reads credentials for Bitbucket operations. There is potential command injection risk if untrusted inputs are passed into shell commands.

medium_findings.title: Potential command injection via execSync
medium_findings.description: Potential command injection if user-provided inputs contain shell metacharacters in execSync commands.

content.value_statement: Pipeline failures waste time and break focus. This skill monitors builds, pulls logs, and triggers reruns with clear CLI workflows.
actual_capabilities: Fetch latest pipeline status and failed builds
List pipeline steps and identify failed steps
Download failed step logs to local files
Test Bitbucket git authentication and clone repositories
limitations: Cannot download pipeline artifacts due to Bitbucket API limits
Requires credentials file setup before use
Needs Node.js v18+ and Git installed
Log files are stored locally and need manual cleanup

use_cases.title: Resolve failed builds
use_cases.description: Locate the latest failed pipeline, download logs, and summarize the failing step quickly.

use_cases.title: Monitor CI status
use_cases.description: Check recent pipelines for a repository and track progress without leaving the editor.

use_cases.title: Manage pipeline runs
use_cases.description: Trigger new builds or stop stuck pipelines with clear command outputs.

prompt_templates.title: Check latest build
prompt_templates.prompt: Get the latest pipeline for workspace X and repo Y, and summarize status and branch.

prompt_templates.title: Find a failed run
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the most recent failed pipeline for workspace X repo Y and list failed steps.

prompt_templates.title: Download failure logs
prompt_templates.prompt: Download logs for failed steps in pipeline UUID Z for workspace X repo Y and summarize key errors.

prompt_templates.title: Trigger a pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the pipeline for branch main in workspace X repo Y and then show the new pipeline status.

output_examples.input: Show the latest failed pipeline and the failed steps.
output: Next step: download logs for these steps

output_examples.input: Download failed logs for pipeline 123 and summarize errors.
output: Suggested fix: add SECRET_KEY to pipeline variables

best_practices: Confirm workspace and repo before running commands
Start with helper commands for common workflows
Review log size before pasting full output
anti_patterns: Passing untrusted input directly into shell commands

faq.question: Do I need to install an MCP server?
faq.answer: No. The skill runs Node CLI commands directly.

faq.question: Where do I put my credentials?
faq.answer: Create a credentials.json file using the provided template.

faq.question: Can it download pipeline artifacts?
faq.answer: No. Bitbucket Cloud does not provide an artifact download API.

faq.question: Where are logs saved?
faq.answer: Logs are saved under .pipeline-logs in your current project.

faq.question: What permissions are required?
faq.answer: App password needs repository read and pipeline read or write.

faq.question: Does it support git operations?
faq.answer: Yes. It can test auth and clone repositories using HTTPS.
